gurmukhi: CutI cMf jwgy bHm kirE ju`D ko swj ]
transliteration: Chhoutoo Channd Jaage Brahm Kario Juddh Ko Saaj||
translation: When the Lord Vishnu awoke from sleep, he made preparations for war.

gurmukhi: dYq sBY Git jwih ijau bFY dyvqn rwj ]10]
transliteration: Dait Sabhai Ghattee Jaah(i) Jio Badhai Devtan Raaj||10||
translation: So that the demons may decrease in number and the rule of gods be increased.10.

gurmukhi: ju`D kirE iqn soN BgvMq n mwr skY Aiq dYq blI hY ]
transliteration: Juddh Kario Tin Son Bhagwant Na Maar Sakai At(i) Dait Badoo Hai||
translation: The Lord waged the war against the demons, but He could not kill them because they were very brave.

gurmukhi: swl Bey iqn pMc hjwr duhUM lrqy nih bwNh tlI hY ]
transliteration: Saal Bhae Tin Panch Hajaar Duhoon Larte Nah(i) Baanh Taloo Hai||
translation: It took five thousand years in fighting, but they were not tired.

gurmukhi: dYqn rIJ kihE br mwNg kihE hir sIsn dyh BlI hY ]
transliteration: Daitan Roojh Kahio Bar Maan Kahio Har(i) Soosan Deh Bhaloo Hai||
translation: Having been pleased with the power of the Lord, the demons asked the Lord to request for a boon, the Lord asked them to surrender their bodies.

gurmukhi: Dwir aurU pir ckR soN kwt kY joiq lY AwpnY AMg mlI hY ]11]
transliteration: Ddaar(i) Uroo Par(i) Charka Son Kaat Kai Jot(i) Lai Aapnai An Mailoo Hai||11||
translation: Putting them in his lap, the Lord cut off their heads and assimilated their strength within Himself.11.

gurmukhi: dyvn QwipE rwj mDukYtB ko mwr kY ]
transliteration: Devan Thaapio Raaj Madhoukaitabh Ko Maar Kai||
translation: The Lord established the rule of gods after killing Madhu and Kaitabh.

gurmukhi: dIno skl smwj bYkuMT gwmI hir Bey ]12]
transliteration: Doono Sakal Samaaj Baikounth Gadmoondhar(i) Bhae||12||
translation: He gave all the paraphernalia to them and Himself went to Heaven.12.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI mwrkMfy pRwny sRI cMfI cirqR aukiq iblws mDkYtB bDih pRQm iDAwie ]1]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Maarkande Puraane Sroo Channdoo Charitra Oukat(i) Bilaas Madhkaitabh Badhah Pratham Dhiaae||1||
translation: End of the First Chapter of ‘The Killing of Madhu and Kaitabh’ as described in CHANDI CHARITRA UKATI of Markandeya Purana.1.

gurmukhi: bhuir BieE mhKwsur iqn qo ikAw kIAw ]
transliteration: Bahur(i) Bhaio Mahkhaasur Tin To Kiaa Kooaa||
translation: Then there appeared Mahishasura and whatever he did is as follows:

gurmukhi: Bujw jor kir ju`D jIq sB jgu lIAw ]
transliteration: Bhujaa Jor Kar(i) Juddh Jeet Sabh Jag(u) Looaa||
translation: With his armed strength, he conquered the whole world.
